worldtimer 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Send Requests to WorldTimeAPI

Source: R/worldtimer.R
worldtimer-functions.Rd

Functions to talk to the WorldTimeAPI http://worldtimeapi.org

Usage

worldtimer(resource, ...)

worldtimer_timezones()

worldtimer_ip(ipv4 = NULL)

Arguments

resource

Path in the WorldTimeAPI. Normally either a valid timezone or an IP.

...

Arguments passed on to httr2::resp_body_json

resp

A response object.

check_type

Check that response has expected content type? Set to FALSE to suppress the automated check

simplifyVector

Should JSON arrays containing only primitives (i.e. booleans, numbers, and strings) be caused to atomic vectors?

ipv4

An ipv4 address for which to return the current time. The default NULL uses the system's public IP address.

Value

list of class worldtimer

Examples

# \donttest{
# Change R option for printing decimal digits of seconds
old <- options(digits.secs = 6)

# Specific timezone
new_york_time <- try(worldtimer("America/New_York"))
str(new_york_time)
#> List of 14
#>  $ abbreviation: chr "EDT"
#>  $ datetime    : chr "2022-03-23T03:35:53.261009-04:00"
#>  $ day_of_week : int 3
#>  $ day_of_year : int 82
#>  $ dst         : logi TRUE
#>  $ dst_from    : chr "2022-03-13T07:00:00+00:00"
#>  $ dst_offset  : int 3600
#>  $ dst_until   : chr "2022-11-06T06:00:00+00:00"
#>  $ raw_offset  : int -18000
#>  $ timezone    : chr "America/New_York"
#>  $ unixtime    : int 1648020953
#>  $ utc_datetime: POSIXct[1:1], format: "2022-03-23 07:35:53.261008"
#>  $ utc_offset  : chr "-04:00"
#>  $ week_number : int 12
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "worldtimer"
print(new_york_time)
#> [1] "2022-03-23 03:35:53.261008 EDT"

# The system's public ip
system_ip <- worldtimer_ip()
str(system_ip)
#> List of 14
#>  $ abbreviation: chr "EDT"
#>  $ datetime    : chr "2022-03-23T03:35:53.308949-04:00"
#>  $ day_of_week : int 3
#>  $ day_of_year : int 82
#>  $ dst         : logi TRUE
#>  $ dst_from    : chr "2022-03-13T07:00:00+00:00"
#>  $ dst_offset  : int 3600
#>  $ dst_until   : chr "2022-11-06T06:00:00+00:00"
#>  $ raw_offset  : int -18000
#>  $ timezone    : chr "America/New_York"
#>  $ unixtime    : int 1648020953
#>  $ utc_datetime: POSIXct[1:1], format: "2022-03-23 07:35:53.308948"
#>  $ utc_offset  : chr "-04:00"
#>  $ week_number : int 12
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "worldtimer"
print(system_ip)
#> [1] "2022-03-23 03:35:53.308948 EDT"

# Other public ip
other_ip <- worldtimer_ip("101.110.34.62")
str(other_ip)
#> List of 14
#>  $ abbreviation: chr "JST"
#>  $ datetime    : chr "2022-03-23T16:35:53.332504+09:00"
#>  $ day_of_week : int 3
#>  $ day_of_year : int 82
#>  $ dst         : logi FALSE
#>  $ dst_from    : NULL
#>  $ dst_offset  : int 0
#>  $ dst_until   : NULL
#>  $ raw_offset  : int 32400
#>  $ timezone    : chr "Asia/Tokyo"
#>  $ unixtime    : int 1648020953
#>  $ utc_datetime: POSIXct[1:1], format: "2022-03-23 07:35:53.332504"
#>  $ utc_offset  : chr "+09:00"
#>  $ week_number : int 12
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "worldtimer"
print(other_ip)
#> [1] "2022-03-23 16:35:53.332504 JST"

# Restore old options
options(old)
# }
